meanings.definition: Of or relating to a numerical order or sequence.
meanings.sent1: The ordinal numbers show the order of the days in a week.
meanings.sent2: She placed the books on the shelf in ordinal fashion.
meanings.sent3: The ordinal arrangement of the toys made it easy to find the one she wanted.
meanings.sent4: In the ordinal system, each number has a specific place in the sequence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used ordinal terms to explain the ranking of the students in the class.

meanings.definition: A number denoting relative position in a sequence, such as first, second, third.
meanings.sent1: The race winner proudly held the gold medal for the first ordinal.
meanings.sent2: She was excited to be the third ordinal in line for the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed the first ordinal spot on the cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: Being the last ordinal in the line, he patiently waited for his turn.
meanings.sent5: The ordinal on the ticket determined her seat at the concert.
